_comment: Created by ianb on 27/04/2015 18:13:12 using v2.5
title: How many patients are affected by delayed transfers by the type of care they received?
analysis_commentary: The overall pattern seen in the number of patients experiencing a delayed transfer of care is not replicated across both types of care patients received. While there is a 31% increase in the number of patients who received acute care with a similar pattern to the total number of patients this is not the case for patients who received non-acute care. Over the same period when receiving non-acute care the number of patients who had a delayed transfer of care decreased from 2,381 patients in August 2010 to 1,607 in February 2015.
data_source: NHS England, Delayed transfer of care
